issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
the api throws this message when hdfs is not configured for accessTime

"Access time for hdfs is not configured.  Please set dfs.support.accessTime configuration parameter."


The property name should be dfs.access.time.precision
fields.summary: FSNamesystem.setTimes throws exception with wrong configuration name in the message

comments.body: attaching patch for branch 1 and trunk

dfs.access.time.precision is deprecated on trunk, is now dfs.namenode.accesstime.precision.  Please use DFS_NAMENODE_ACCESSTIME_PRECISION_KEY so we don't have hard-coded keys in the error message, will prevent future bugs like this.
Thanks Eli. Attached the patch for trunk using the config key.
Thanks Arpit.  +1 to the trunk and branch-1 patches. I've committed them and also merged to 23.
Btw didn't run jenkins since this is a trivial change.

Integrated in Hadoop-Common-trunk-Commit #1543 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-Common-trunk-Commit/1543/])
    HDFS-2790. FSNamesystem.setTimes throws exception with wrong configuration name in the message. Contributed by Arpit Gupta

eli : http://svn.apache.org/viewcvs.cgi/?root=Apache-SVN&view=rev&rev=1231572
Files : 
* /hadoop/common/trunk/hadoop-hdfs-project/hadoop-hdfs/CHANGES.txt
* /hadoop/common/trunk/hadoop-hdfs-project/hadoop-hdfs/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hdfs/server/namenode/FSNamesystem.java

-1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12510596/HDFS-2790.patch
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    -1 tests included.  The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
                        Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
                        Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

    -1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool appears to have generated 21 warning messages.

    +1 javac.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    +1 eclipse:eclipse.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    -1 findbugs.  The patch appears to introduce 1 new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    -1 release audit.  The applied patch generated 1 release audit warnings (more than the trunk's current 0 warnings).

    +1 core tests.  The patch passed unit tests in .

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.
